intro: Sonchus nymanii, commonly known as field sowthistle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant has alternate, deeply lobed leaves that are often hairy on the underside, and it produces yellow flowers in a composite inflorescence. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it is characterized by its milky sap and is part of the Asteraceae family.
